OWASP BeNeLux Days Conference 2022

by OWASP Foundation


The '22 conference is over :(

But we will meet you next year:

Mark the date: we will host the 2023 edition on 23 and 24th of November in Belgium!



Conference program on 24/11/2022

  • 100x your AppSec Program by Grant Ongers
  • CTF Kickoff with OWASP WrongSecrets by Jeroen Willemsen and Ben De Haan
  • Social engineering and physical entry, a Red Teamer's toolbox by Ben Brucker
  • Security by Meme - Less FUD, more FUN by Bram Patelski
  • INCONTROLLER - New Malware Developed to Target Industrial Control Systems by Daniel Kapellmann Zafra & Ken Proska
  • Are your APIs rugged? by Colin Domoney
  • Assessing the state of practice of threat modeling in Dutch organizations by Koen Yskout
  • When hackers and cats help - Redesigning security during a crisis by Brenno de Winter

Trainings on 25/11/2022

  • OWASP SAMM by Sebastien Deleersnyder
  • OWASP Mobile Application Security (MAS / MASVS / MASTG) by Jeroen Beckers
  • Hurding OpenKAT by Brenno de Winter
  • Securing DevOps pipelines by Filip Chyla and Marinus Kuivenhoven

OWASP BeNeLux conference is free, but registration is required!

To support the OWASP organisation, consider to become a member, it's only US$50! Check out the Membership page to find out more.


What Happens at a OWASP BeNeLux Days Conference?

Never been to an OWASP BeNeLux Days Conference?
Here’s a bit of info to provide some background.

  • Technical talks by experts in security, devops, and cloud
  • Panels to debate tough topics
  • Training sessions for hands on learning in top security areas
  • Keynotes from industry leaders
  • Vendor booths to promote the latest advances in security technology
  • A variety of other activities such as recruiting fair, capture the flag, security tool training, and more
